metadata.description: Full-syntax enumeration commands extracted from preservation plan Phase 2C.1c
metadata.notes: Filtered duplicates - original extraction had 10 items but 4 were monitoring duplicates

commands.name: List SMB Shares (Windows CLI)
commands.description: List contents of remote SMB share using Windows command prompt

variables.name: <TARGET>
variables.description: Target Windows host IP or hostname

commands.notes:
Windows-style UNC path.

Requires authentication to target.

Use 'dir' for more details.

Common shares:
C$, ADMIN$, IPC$.

From Linux:
smbclient //target/share

commands.name: GPP Password Decryption Script
commands.description: Decrypt Group Policy Preferences cPassword attribute using known AES key

variables.name: <CPASSWORD>
variables.description: Encrypted cpassword value from Groups.xml or other GPP files

commands.notes:
Group Policy Preferences vulnerability (MS14-025).

AES key published by Microsoft.

Python script:
gpp-decrypt.

PowerShell:
Get-GPPPassword.

cPassword found in SYSVOL XML files.

commands.name: Convert Domain to Distinguished Name
commands.description: Convert current domain FQDN to LDAP Distinguished Name format
commands.notes:
PowerShell one-liner to convert domain.local to DC=domain,DC=local format.

Useful for constructing LDAP queries.

Example:
corp.local becomes DC=corp,DC=local.

Required for many AD LDAP operations.

commands.name: Hashcat Kerberos AES256-CBC Mode

flag_explanations.-m 22921: Hash mode for Kerberos 5 AS-REP AES256-CBC (specific cipher mode)

commands.notes:
Mode 22921 is for AES256-CBC specifically, NOT aes-256-ctr.

For AS-REP roasting.

Different from -m 19700 (Kerberos TGS-REP).

Obtained via Rubeus, GetNPUsers.py, or similar tools.

commands.name: Manual Password Hash Generation
commands.command: for pw in $(cat <WORDLIST>); do echo -n "$pw" | md5sum; done
commands.description: Generate MD5 hashes for wordlist manually using shell loop (educational/fallback)
commands.notes:
Bash one-liner for educational purposes or when hashcat/john unavailable.

Extremely slow compared to dedicated tools.

Change md5sum to sha1sum, sha256sum, etc.

for other algorithms.

Not recommended for production use.
